children.name: dial b1
children.definition: dialverb-ll-orus usually-l-quay số
examples: to operate a telephone or make a telephone call to someone by pressing a particularseries of buttons with numbers, or moving a disc with numbers, on the telephone
_can i dial this numberdirect, or do i have to go through the operator?
_dial 0 for the switchboard.
speed dialverb[ i or t ]quay số nhanh

children.name: call a2
children.definition: call cuộc gọi
examples: when you use the telephone
we keep getting calls from newspaper reporters.
with pre
a call for/to/ from
mr deckard, there’s a call for you. will you take it in your office?
i got a call froman old college friend last night.
i made a call to a friend in london.
adj/ noun + call
a phone/telephone call
i had a phone call from barbara in australia.
after several telephone calls, detectives traced two witnesses to the accident.
a quick call
this is just a quick call to make sure you’re ok.
a local/ long-distance call
local calls are free at weekends.
i’d like to make a long-distance call.
an international call
conference callnoun[ c ] (=a work telephone call that involves three or more people )
a collect call[us](= one paid for by the person who receives it )
can i make a collect call to florida, please?
incoming/outgoing calls(= coming into or going out of a place )
you have to dial 9 first to make an outgoing call.
an emergency call(= to the police, fire service, or ambulance service )
the police normally respond immediately to an emergency call.
an anonymous call(= in which the caller does not give their name )
the £10,000 demand was made in an anonymous call to his home.
a hoax call(= one intended to trick someone )
they received a hoax call warning of a bomb in the building.
a crank call(= made by someone you do not know, as a joke or to annoy you )
the heavy breathing sounded like a crank call.
verb + call
get/ have/ receive[formal]a call
at 11 in the evening we got a call from the police.
the radio station receiveda lot of calls complaining about the show's bad language.
expect a call
she’s expecting a phone call from matt.
sentence
there is/was a call
there was a phone call for you.
if there are any calls forme, could you write them down next to the telephone?

children.name: to succeed in contacting sb by telephone
get hold of b2
children.definition: get hold of/ˌget ˈhəʊld ɒv/  to succeed in contacting someone by telephone after trying several times: liên lạc (qua điện thoại)
examples: where have you been? i’ve been trying to get hold of you all week.
it’s no use trying to phone linda at work -- she’s impossible to get hold of.

get hold of sbto succeed in contacting someone by telephone after trying several times :where have you been? i've been trying to get hold of you all week.|it's no use trying to phone linda at work – she's impossible to get hold of.

children.name: get through x
children.definition: get through /ˌget ˈθruː/  to succeed in contacting someone by telephone, especially after a delay or technical problem:
examples: liên lạc (qua điện thoại)
▪ i finally got through, but it took several minutes.
tôi cuối cùng cũng gọi được, nhưng phải mất vài phút.
get through to somebody
liên lạc (qua điện thoại) cho ai đó
▪ by the way, did you get through to sharon?
nhân tiện, bạn đã gọi được cho sharon chưa ?
▪ i hate dealing with the bank over the phone. it takes ages to get through to the right person.
tôi ghét phải làm việc với ngân hàng qua điện thoại. phải mất rất lâu liên lạc được với đúng người.

children.name: reach b2
children.definition: reach/riːtʃ/  to contact someone by telephone - use this especially when you are saying whether you can or cannot contact them:
examples: liên lạc (qua điện thoại)
▪ you can reach me here through friday. i leave for denver saturday.
bạn có thể liên lạc với tôi đến hết thứ sáu. thứ bảy tôi đi denver rồi.
▪ have you been able to reach neil?
bạn gọi được cho neil không ?
reachverbcommunicate liên lạc với ai (qua điện thoại...)
[ t ] to communicate with someone in a different place, especially by telephone or post
_the only way to reach them in the place where they're staying isbymail.
_i've been trying to reach you on the phone all day.

children.name: when you want to leave a message for sb
leave a message a1
children.definition: leave a message/ˌliːv ə ˈmesɪdʒ/  để lại lời nhắn
examples: ▪ no, she didn’t leave a message.
leave a message forđể lại lời nhắn cho
▪ tom left a message for mike on the answering machine.

children.name: can/may i take a message? a1
children.definition: can/may i take a message?/ˌkæn, ˌmeɪ aɪ teɪk ə ˈmesɪdʒ/  spoken say this on the telephone when you are offering to give a message to someone else: tôi có thể để lại lời nhắn không?
examples: ▪ i’m sorry, mr. perry isn’t in yet. may i take a message?

children.name: text a2
children.definition: text/tekst/  gửi tin nhắn
examples: to send a written message from your mobile phone to someone else’s:
▪ my daughter spends nearly all her time either on the phone or texting her friends.
▪ text me as soon as you get your exam results.
textverb[ t ]
to send someone atext message
_i texted her to arrange a time to meet.

children.name: voicemail x
children.definition: voicemail/ˈvɔɪsmeɪl/  a system on the phone by which you can leave a spoken message for someone: hộp thư thoại
examples: ▪ hi jen - i see i’ve reached your voicemail - i’ll try and get back to you later.
▪ i keep my voicemail on most mornings and deal with all my messages in the afternoon.
voicemailnoun[ u ]thư thoại
an electronic telephone answering system used especially by organizations and mobile phone users

children.name: caller x
children.definition: caller/ˈkɔːləʳ/  someone who is making a telephone call - used especially by people who work with telephones: người gọi
examples: ▪ did the caller leave a number?
▪ hold on please, i have an overseas call for you. go ahead, caller.

children.name: operator x
children.definition: operatornountổng đài viên
examples: a person who helps to connect people on a telephone system
switchboard operatornoun[ c ]tổng đài viên
a person whose job is to receive telephone calls and connect them to other numbers

children.name: telephonist x
children.definition: telephonistnounuknhân viên điện thoại;
examples: a switchboard operator

children.name: when you use the telephone in order to tell sb sth
on/over the phone a1
children.definition: on/over the phone/ɒn, əʊvəʳ ðə ˈfəʊn/
examples: thông qua điện thoại
▪ you can buy them by credit card over the phone.
▪ the ticket office told me on the phone that i’d have front-row seats in section d.
▪ i didn’t want to go into details on the phone, so we arranged a meeting in my office for the next day.
▪ maria started crying over the phone as she told me about it.
talk/speak on the phonenói điện thoại
▪ marie and i talk on the phone at least once a week.

children.name: by phone/telephone a1
children.definition: by phone/telephone/baɪ ˈfəʊn, ˈtelfəʊn/  if you tell someone something by phone or by telephone, you make a telephone call to tell them it:
examples: bằng điện thoại
▪ the survey questions 500 people a month by phone.
▪ reservations can be made by telephone, but must be confirmed in writing within seven days.

children.name: tone b2
children.definition: tonetín hiệu
examples: one of the sounds that you hear on a telephone line when you pick up the receiver
i've called him several times but i keep getting the engaged tone.
dial tone[us] |dialling tone[uk] [c usually singular]
a continuous sound which tells you that a telephone is connected to the telephone system and is ready to be used
please wait until you hear the ukdialling/ usdialtone before inserting your money.

children.name: get through x
children.definition: get through/ˌget ˈθruː/  kết nối được, gọi được
examples: to succeed in reaching someone by telephone:
i tried calling my parents, but i couldn’t get through.
get through to
did you get through to mr mcwhirter?

children.name: dead zone x
children.definition: dead zonenoun vùng chết (không bắt được sóng)
examples: a place where a mobile phone does not work because there is no signal

children.name: connect x
children.definition: connectverbtelephonenối; kết nối
examples: [ t ] to make it possible for you to speak to someone else by telephone
_could you connect mewith/toa number inparis, please? i can't seem to get through.

children.name: hotline x
children.definition: hotline đường dây nóng
examples: a special direct telephone connection for emergencies
a national telephone hotline has been set up for students suffering from stress.

children.name: area code x
children.definition: dialling codenounuk(usarea code)mãvùng
examples: a series of numbers used before the main telephone number when you telephonesomeone outside your own town or area
area codenoun[ c ]mã số vùng điện thoại
dialling code

children.name: ringtone x
children.definition: ringtone nhạc chuông
examples: the sound that a telephone makes, especially a mobile phone when someone is ringing it
my phone came with 20 optional ringtones.

children.name: connection x
children.definition: connectionnountelephone(sự) kết nối; (sự) nối
examples: [ c ] when it is possible for two people to speak to each other by telephone
_sorry, could you repeat that? this is a verybadconnection.

children.name: number a1
children.definition: numbernounsymbolsố điện thoại;số dây nói
examples: [ c ] (written abbreviationno.) a telephone number
_i gave him my number.
phone numbernoun[ c ]
the number that you use to call a particular phone
telephone numbernoun[ c ]số điện thoại;số dây nói
a phone number
mobile numbernoun[ c ]số di động
the number for your mobile phone

children.name: get cut off/get disconnected x
children.definition: get cut off/get disconnected/get ˌkʌt ˈɒf, get ˌdɪskəˈnektd/  if you get cut off or get disconnected when you are making a telephone call, the telephone suddenly stops working in the middle of your conversation and you cannot continue:
examples: bị ngắt vì lỗi đường truyền
▪ we got cut off in the middle of the conversation.
▪ i don’t know what happened, we just got disconnected.
cutsboffphrasal verbphone
[ usually passive ]to stop people from continuing a telephone
conversation by breakingthe telephone connection
_we were cut off before she could give me directions.

children.name: when a telephone line is busy
busy/engaged x
children.definition: busy/engaged
examples: [adjective] a telephonelinethat is busy is already being used by the person that you want to telephone, so you cannot speak to them:
bận
▪ she tried to call lisa, but the phone was busy.
▪ i called mom again, but it was still busy.
▪ he tried nick’s suite again. this time the line was engaged.
▪ janice’s number is still engaged. she’s been on the phone all morning.
engaged tonebritish /busysignalamerican the sound a telephone makes when the person you are trying to call is already using the telephone
tín hiệu bận
▪ i’ve been trying to call the customer helpline, but all i’m getting is a busy signal.

children.name: on hold c1
children.definition: on hold/ɒn ˈhəʊld/  waiting to speak to someone on the phone who cannot speak to you immediately because they are already speaking to someone else on the telephone: chờ
examples: ▪ you’re always on hold for about 10 minutes before you get to talk to anyone.
put somebody on hold để ai đó chờ
▪ i put dana on hold while i tried to find steve.
on hold
if you are on holdwhen using the telephone,you are waitingto speak to someone
_mr briggs is on hold.
_his phone is engaged - can iputyou on hold?

children.name: to fail in contacting sb by telephone
lose contact b1
children.definition: lose contact to no longer be able to contact sb by radio or electronic signals, as a result of technical problems: mất liên lạc
examples: lose contact with
air traffic control say they’ve lost contact with the plane.
